metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25212 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A TOCTOU mismatch in the NFS client code in the Linux kernel before 5.8.3 could be used by local attackers to corrupt memory or possibly have unspecified other impact because a size check is in fs/nfs/nfs4proc.c instead of fs/nfs/nfs4xdr.c, aka CID-b4487b935452. It was discovered that the NFS client implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform bounds checking before copying security labels in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-190.220').

linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1085.90~16.04.1').
